intro: Paepalanthus harmsii, commonly known as the Harms' puya, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its unique, spiky inflorescence that resembles a bottlebrush. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are arranged in dense clusters along the central axis. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal rainfall. Paepalanthus harmsii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is a striking addition to botanical gardens due to its ornamental appearance.
